-- | Haskell extended file attributes interface

@package xattr
@version 0.6.2


-- | Relatively low-level interface to work with extended attributes on
--   Unix systems. This is a fairly straightforward port of the API exposed
--   by SGI's libattr.
module System.Xattr

-- | Set extended attribute of a filesystem object.
setxattr :: FilePath -> AttrName -> AttrValue -> XattrMode -> IO ()

-- | Same as <a>setxattr</a>, but if the object is a symbolic link the
--   attribute is set on the symbolic link itself, not the object refered
--   to by the link.
lsetxattr :: FilePath -> AttrName -> AttrValue -> XattrMode -> IO ()

-- | Same as <a>setxattr</a>, but set the attribute of an open handle.
fsetxattr :: Handle -> AttrName -> AttrValue -> XattrMode -> IO ()

-- | Get extended attribute of an object.
getxattr :: FilePath -> AttrName -> IO AttrValue

-- | Same as <a>getxattr</a>, but if the object is a symbolic link, the
--   attribute is retrieved from the link itself and not the referenced
--   object.
lgetxattr :: FilePath -> AttrName -> IO AttrValue

-- | Same as <a>getxattr</a>, but get the attribute of an open handle.
fgetxattr :: Handle -> AttrName -> IO AttrValue

-- | Get a list of all of the extended attributes of an object.
listxattr :: FilePath -> IO [AttrName]

-- | Same as <a>listxattr</a>, but if the object is a symbolic link, the
--   attributes of the link itself are returned, not on the referenced
--   object.
llistxattr :: FilePath -> IO [AttrName]

-- | Same as <a>listxattr</a>, but get the attributes of an open handle.
flistxattr :: Handle -> IO [AttrName]

-- | The name of an attribute. Some filesystems support arbitrarily long
--   names, but for portability it is recommended to use relatively short
--   names (less than 256 bytes).
type AttrName = String

-- | Thevalue of an attribute. Most filesystems allow for arbitrary binary
--   data with relatively. It is recommended that the length of the value
--   be at most 64KB.
type AttrValue = ByteString

-- | Mode for setting attributes.
data XattrMode

-- | The attribute will be created if it does not yet exist, and replace
--   the existing named attribute otherwise.
RegularMode :: XattrMode

-- | Specifies a pure create, which fails if the named attribute exists
--   already.
CreateMode :: XattrMode

-- | Specifies a pure replace operation, which fails if the named attribute
--   does not already exist.
ReplaceMode :: XattrMode
instance Eq XattrMode
instance Show XattrMode
instance Enum XattrMode
